ComicInfo.Summary:
A faux ad for 4-Playo, the amazing foreplay robot.
A faux ad from the Bathroom Council
A faux ad for a presecription medication.
A faux ad for a hat
Robin Hood, Abraham Lincoln, and Rip Van Winkle battle the Behemoth. A parody of Alan Moore's and Kevin O'Neill's League of Extraordinary Gentlemen comics.
An ad for penis removal.
The Head flips burgers while waiting for his chance at world domination.
A parody of the Dick Tracy comic strip villains.
A beautiful woman and a fat man visit detective Johnny Silhouette.
Non-sequitur panels from faux romance comics.
A faux ad for a doll.
Ted and Mary worry about the Goofy Gravity Master.
Merlin turns a spoiled child into the Silver Knight.
Pagus laughs at Easter Eggs.
A diver annoys a big fish.
Comics making no use of perspective or sensible layout.
A faux ad for Spankio, the amazing spanking robot.
A faux ad.
A parody of the television series "Murder She Wrote".
A faux ad for portraits in which the eyes don't move.
Grampa gets on Noah's Ark.
Gramps climbs a ladder to the moon.
Super-heroes worked in factories in the 30s.
People made their own spaceships in the '30s.
A man volunteers to be shrunk.
Rocco threatens some ants.
An actor wonders if he smells like a hobo and why he isn't getting more laughs.
A faux ad for a series of educational booklets.
